summary: This document is an email chain from January 2020 regarding the handling of correspondence from Arlan Ettinger, President of Guernsey's Auctioneers & Brokers, concerning the property of the late Jeffrey Epstein. The correspondence was forwarded to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO-SDNY) for handling as part of a close-out process.

persons.name: Arlan Ettinger
persons.context: He is the sender of the original correspondence regarding the property of the late Jeffrey Epstein, which is being forwarded through the Department of Justice for handling.

persons.name: Nathaniel Gamble II
persons.role: Official from ODAG (Office of the Deputy Attorney General)
persons.context: He advised that the correspondence from Arlan Ettinger regarding Jeffrey Epstein's property be assigned to USAO-SDNY for handling.

connections.description: Ettinger, as an auctioneer, is corresponding about handling Epstein's property after his death.
Gamble directed Ettinger's correspondence regarding Epstein's property to be handled by USAO-SDNY.

events.title: Email chain regarding Epstein property handling
events.description: Internal DOJ email chain discussing how to handle correspondence from auctioneer Arlan Ettinger about Jeffrey Epstein's property, as part of a close-out process.

events.title: Initial correspondence from Arlan Ettinger
events.description: Arlan Ettinger sends correspondence regarding the property of the late Jeffrey Epstein to the DOJ, which is then assigned to USAO-SDNY.

keyFacts: Arlan Ettinger, President of Guernsey's Auctioneers & Brokers, corresponded with the DOJ regarding the property of the late Jeffrey Epstein.
Nathaniel Gamble II from the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG) assigned the handling of this matter to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USAO-SDNY).
The email chain from January 2020 shows internal DOJ coordination on how to handle Epstein's property as part of a 'close-out process' following his death.
The correspondence indicates ongoing posthumous financial and administrative matters related to Jeffrey Epstein's estate.
